ARABIC: بِسْمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحْمَٰنِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ وَصَدُّوا۟ عَن سَبِيلِ ٱللَّهِ أَضَلَّ أَعْمَٰلَهُمْ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: As for those who are kafir and bar others from the Way of Allah, Allah will make their actions go astray.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: THOSE WHO DISBELIEVE and obstruct (others) from the way of God will have wasted their deeds.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Allah has caused the works of those who disbelieve and hinder people from the way of Allah to go to waste.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: God has made devoid of all virtue the deeds of those who have disbelieved and prevented others from the way of God.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Allah has destroyed the deeds of those who disbelieved and prevented from Allah’s way.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Those who disbelieve and hinder (men) from the path of Allah, He will render their deeds vain.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: (As for) those who disbelieve and turn away from Allah's way, He shall render their works ineffective.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Those who disbelieve and bar from God's way, God will send their works astray.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Those who disbelieve and turn (men) from the way of Allah, He rendereth their actions vain.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: God will bring to naught all the good deeds of those who are bent on denying the truth and bar [others] from the path of God.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Those who disbelieve and hinder others from the way of Allah, He shall send their works astray.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Those who are [themselves] faithless and bar [others] from the way of Allah—He has rendered their works fruitless.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Those who reject Allah and hinder (men) from the Path of Allah,- their deeds will Allah render astray (from their mark).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Those who disbelieve [in the Oneness of Allah, and in the Message of Prophet Muhammad SAW], and hinder (men) from the Path of Allah (Islamic Monotheism), He will render their deeds vain.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Those who disbelieve and bar from the way of Allah, Allah will cause their deeds go astray.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Those who disbelieve and repel from the path of God—He nullifies their works.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Those who disbelieve and avert [people] from the way of Allah - He will waste their deeds.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [47:1] Those who disbelieve, from among the people of Mecca, and bar, others, from the way of God, that is to say, [from] faith, He will leave their works to waste, such as giving food [to the poor] or being kind to kin, and so they will find no reward for these [works of theirs] in the Hereafter; [but] they are requited for them in this world [purely] out of His bounty, exalted be He.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: And from his narration on the authority of Ibn 'Abbas that he said regarding the interpretation of Allah's saying (Those who disbelieve): '(Those who disbelieve) in Muhammad (pbuh) and the Qur'an (and turn (men) from the way of Allah) and prevent people from the religion and obedience of Allah-the reference here is to those who fed the army of the disbelievers on the Day of Badr: 'Utbah and Shaybah the sons of Rabi'ah, Munbih and Nabih the sons of al-Hajjaj, Abu'l-Buhturi Ibn Hisham and Abu Jahl Ibn Hisham and their host-, (He rendereth their actions vain) He thwarts their good deeds and spending on the Day of Badr.
